content.title: Scholarship Scheme for Worker's Children- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
content.beneficiary: Children of workers employed in industrial and commercial institutions
content.details: The scheme 'Scholarship Scheme for Worker's Children' is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to children of workers and workers employed in industrial and commercial institutions of Haryana state to continue their studies. The amount of scholarship is given to workers and children of workers (3 girls and 2 boys) on passing the examination and continuing their studies in the next grade.
benefits: ₹15,000/- for All Types of Bachelor's Degrees
₹15,000/- for Polytechnic Diploma, C.A.D. Pharmacy, A.N.M., G.N.M. and Other Undergraduate Diploma Courses
₹20,000/- for All types of Engineering Degrees, B. Pharmacy
₹20,000/- for All Types of Post Graduate Degrees Diplomas/B.Sc Nursing
Amount for All Types of Medical Degrees (MBBS, BDS, BAMS, etc.)
eligibility: The applicant should be employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.
The worker should be registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board.
The monthly salary of the worker should not exceed ₹25,000/-.
The service period of the worker is fixed for one year.
The worker or the worker's children studying in 9th grade or above are eligible for the scheme's benefits.
The scheme benefits are available to three girls and two boys per worker.
exclusions: The worker's children who are self-employed or employed are not covered under this scheme.
On re-appearance/compartment, the student will not be eligible for the scheme.
documents_required: ID Proof of worker issued by the organization
Continuing Study Certificate (Generated by the Principal/Headmaster of the concerned school).

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective is to provide financial assistance to the children of workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments in Haryana to help them continue their studies.

faqs.question: What are the scholarship amounts provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Scholarships ranging from ₹10,000 to ₹21,000 are provided for different classes.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scholarship?
faqs.answer: Workers employed in industrial or commercial establishments in Haryana, registered with the HLWB, earning a monthly salary of up to ₹25,000, with a service period of one year are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How many children per worker can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Three girls and two boys per worker can benefit from this scheme.

faqs.question: Are children of workers who are self-employed or employed eligible?
faqs.answer: No, children of workers who are self-employed or employed are not covered under this scheme.

faqs.question: Are students with reappear/compartment exams eligible for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, students with reappear/compartment exams are not eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the last date to submit the application form for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The last date for submission is December 31st. Applications submitted after this date will not be considered.

faqs.question: Can a child receiving a scholarship from another institution also avail benefits from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, a child receiving a scholarship from another institution can also avail benefits from this scheme.

faqs.question: What happens if a student receives a scholarship by providing a false certificate?
faqs.answer: They will be disqualified from receiving future scholarships and will have to repay the amount received.

faqs.question: Are children who resume their education after dropping out eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, children who resume their education after dropping out are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Are children studying outside Haryana eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, children continuing their education outside Haryana are eligible for the scheme.
